summary.department: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

responsibilities.details: Investigate, characterise, and develop ontologies of software vulnerabilities in the edge computing environment.
Monitor and/or analyse source code, software behaviours, and software environment to identify potential vulnerabilities and assess their impacts.
Predict or identify vulnerabilities early to fix them quickly and effectively, preventing potential exploitation.
Investigate software quality certification/robustness to cyber disturbances and cyber-attacks.
Identify quality issues with AI models implementation on edge and offer mitigation strategies.

employment_terms.renewal: May be renewed or made permanent subject to availability of funding.

summary.collaboration: Member of the National Edge AI Hub research project.

eligibility.degree: PhD in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or Computer Science
research_experience: Recent relevant research experience in areas of Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Edge Computing, and/or Cybersecurity.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow.
Solid understanding of edge intelligence and software vulnerabilities.
Ability to work effectively as part of a research team.

publication_details.expected: Strong publication record commensurate with stage of career.

summary.school: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

essential: Have or be about to obtain a PhD degree in relevant field.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks.
